5.44.010 Definitions. Whenever used in this chapter, unless a different meaning clearly appears from the context, the following words shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section:
(1) "Charitable" means the words patriotic, philanthropic, social service, welfare, benevolent, educational, civic or fraternal, either actual or purported.
(2) "Contributions" mans the words alms, food, clothing, money, subscription, property or donations under the guise of a loan of money or property.
(3) "Person" means any individual, firm, co-partnership, corporation, company, association or joint stock association, church, religious sect,
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 43
religious denomination, society, organization or league and includes any trustee, receiver, assignee, agent, or other similar representative thereof.
(4) "Promoter" means any person who promotes, manages, supervises, organizes or attempts to promote, manage, supervise, organize a campaign of solicitation.
(5) "Religious" and "religion" as used in this chapter shall not mean the work "charitable" as defined in this chapter, but shall be given their commonly accepted definitions.
(6) "Solicit" and "solicitation" means the request directly or indirectly of money, credit, property, financial assistance or other thing of value, on the plea or representation that such money, credit, property, financial assistance or other thing of value will be used for a charitable or religious purpose as those purposes are defined in this section. These words shall also mean and include the following methods of securing moneys credit, property, financial assistance or other thing of value on the plea or representation that it will be used for a charitable or religious purpose as defined in this section:
(A) Any oral or written request;
(B) The distribution, circulation, mailing, posting or publishing of any handbill, written advertisement or publication;
(C) The making of any announcement to the press, over the radio, by telephone or telegraph concerning an appeal, assemblage, athletic or sports event, bazaar, benefit, campaign, contest, dance, drive, entertainment, exhibition, exposition, party, performance, picnic, sale or social gathering, which the public is requested to patronize or to which the public is requested to make contribution for any charitable or religious purpose connected therewith;
(D) The sale of, offer or attempt to sell any advertisement, advertising space, book, card, chance, coupon, device, magazine, membership, merchandise, subscription, ticket or other thing in connection with which any appeal is made for any charitable or religious purpose, or where the name of any charitable or religious person is used or referred to in any such appeal as an inducement or reason for making any such sale, or when or where in connection with any such sale, any statement is made that the
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 44
whole or any part of the proceeds from any such sale will go or be donated by any charitable or religious purpose. A "solicitation" as defined in this subsection shall be deemed completed when made, whether or not the person making the same receives any contribution or makes any sale referred to in this section. (Ord. 977 §1, 1978).
5.44.020 Permit--Required--Exemptions. No person shall solicit contributions for any charitable purpose within the city of Ephrata without a permit from the city clerk-treasurer authorizing such solicitations; provided, however, that the pro- visions of this section shall not apply to any established person organized and operated exclusively for religious or charitable purposes and not operated for the pecuniary profit of any person if the solicitations by such established person are conducted among the members thereof by other members or officers thereof, voluntarily and without remuneration for making such solicitations, or if the solicitations are in the form of collections or contributions at the regular assemblies or services of any such established person, nor shall the provisions of this chapter apply to any established person organized and operated exclusively for religious or charitable purposes, and holding a valid letter from the United States Internal Revenue Service certifying that such person is exempt from the payment of income taxes under Section 503(c) of the Internal Revenue code or any other applicable section; which organization has a slate of officers comprised of residents of the city of Ephrata and is regularly conducting its activities and meetings within the corporate limits of the city of Ephrata. (Ord. 977 §2, 1978).
5.44.030 Permit--Application--Contents. An application for a permit to solicit as provided by Section 5.44.020 of this Chapter shall be made to the city clerk-treasurer upon forms provided by the city of Ephrata. Such application shall be sworn to and filed with the clerk-treasurer at least fifteen days prior to the time at which the permit applied for shall become effective; provided, however, that the clerk-treasurer may for good cause shown allow the filing of an application less than fifteen days prior to the effective date of the permit applied for. The application herein required shall contain the following information, or in lieu thereof, a detailed statement of the reason or reasons why such information cannot be furnished:
(1) The name, address or headquarters of the person applying for the permit;
(2) If applicant is not an individual, the names and addresses of the
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 45
applicant's principal officers and managers and a copy of the resolution, if any, authorizing such solicitation, certified to as a true and correct copy of the original by the officer having charge of applicant's records;
(3) The purpose for which such solicitation is to be made, the total amount of funds proposed to be raised thereby, and the use or disposition to be made of any receipts therefrom;
(4) A specific statement, supported by reasons and, if available, figures, showing the need for the contributions to be solicited;
(5) The names and addresses of the person or persons by whom the receipts of such solicitations shall be disbursed;
(6) The name and address of the person or persons who will be in direct charge of conducting the solicitation and the names of all promoters connected or to be connected with the proposed solicitation;
(7) An outline of the method or methods to be used in conducting the solicitations;
(8) The time when such solicitations shall be made, giving the preferred dates for the beginning and ending of such solicitation;
(9) The estimated cost of the solicitation;
(10) The amount of wages, fees, commissions, expenses or emoluments to be expended or paid to any person in connection with such solicitations, and the names and addresses of all such persons;
(11) A financial statement for the last preceding fiscal year of any funds collected for charitable purposes by the applicant, said statement giving the amount of money so raised, together with the cost of raising it, and final distribution thereof;
(12) A full statement of the character and extent of the charitable work being done by the applicant within the city;
(13) A statement that the actual cost of the solicitation will not exceed twenty-five percent of the total amount to be raised;
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 46
(14) A statement to the effect that if a permit is granted, it will not be used or represented in any way as an endorsement by the city of Ephrata, or by any department or officer thereof;
(15) Such other information as may be reasonably required by the clerk-treasurer in order for the clerk-treasurer to determine the kind and character of the proposed solicitation and whether such solicitation is in the interest of, and not economical to, the public welfare. If, while any application is pending, or during the term of any permit granted thereon, there is any change in fact, policy or method that would alter the information given in the application, the applicant shall notify the clerk-treasurer in writing thereof within twenty-four hours after such change. (Ord. 977 §3, 1978).
5.44.040 Permit--Application--Investigation. The clerk- treasurer shall examine all applications filed under Section 5.44.030 of this chapter and shall make, or cause to be made, such further investigation of the application and the applicant as the clerk-treasurer shall deem necessary in order for him to perform his duties under this chapter. Upon request by the clerk-treasurer, the applicant shall make available for inspection by the clerk-treasurer, or any person designated in writing by the clerk-treasurer as his representative for such purpose, all of the applicant's books, records and papers at any reasonable time before the application is granted, during the time a permit is in effect, or after a permit has expired. (Ord. 977 §4, 1978).
5.44.050 Permit--Granting. The clerk-treasurer shall issue the permit provided for in Section 5.44.020 of this chapter whenever he shall find the following facts to exist;
(1) That all of the statements made in the application are true;
(2) That the applicant has a good character and reputation for honesty and integrity, or if the applicant is not an individual person, that every member, managing officer or agent of the applicant has a good character or reputation for honesty and integrity;
(3) That the control and supervision of the solicitation will be under responsible and reliable persons;
(4) That the applicant has not engaged in any fraudulent transaction or enterprise;
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 47
(5) That the solicitation will not be a fraud on the public;
(6) That the solicitation is prompted solely by a desire to finance the charitable cause described in the application, and will not be conducted primarily for private profit;
(7) That the cost of raising the funds will be reasonable. Any such cost in excess of twenty-five percent of the amount collected shall be considered to be unreasonable unless special facts are presented showing that peculiar reasons make a cost higher than twenty-five percent reasonable in the particular case. The clerk-treasurer shall file in his office for public inspection, and shall serve upon the applicant by registered mail, a written statement of his finding of facts and his decision upon each application. (Ord. 977 §5, 1978).
5.44.060 Permit--Fee. Before a permit is issued there shall be paid to the clerk-treasurer of the city of Ephrata the sum of ten dollars as a permit fee and the sum of one dollar for each facsimile copy of the permit that is desired. (Ord. 977 §6, 1978).
5.44.070 Permit--Form--Duration. Permits issued under this chapter shall bear the name and address of the person by whom the solicitation is to be made, the number of the permit, the date issued, the dates within which the permit holder may solicit, and a statement that the permit does not constitute an endorsement by the city of Ephrata or by any of its departments, officers or employees of the purpose or of the person conducting the solicitation. All permits must be signed by the clerk-treasurer. No permit may grant the right to solicit longer than ninety days from its date, but the clerk-treasurer may extent any permit for not more than ninety additional days upon a showing that unnecessary hardship would be created by a failure to extend the original ninety-day period for such additional days. (Ord. 977 §7, 1978).
5.44.080 Permit--Nontransferable--Return. Any permit issued under this chapter shall be nontransferable and shall be returned to the clerk-treasurer within two days of its date of expiration, together with all facsimile copies thereof. (Ord. 977 §8, 1978).
5.44.090 Solicitors--Credentials. All persons to whom permits have been issued under this chapter shall furnish proper credentials to their agents and solicitors for such solicitation. Such credentials shall include the name of the permit holder, the date, a statement describing said holder's charitable activity, a description of the purpose of the solicitation, the signature of the
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 48
permit holder or of the holder's chief executive officer, and the name, address, age, sex and signature of the solicitor to whom such credentials are issued and the specific period of time during which said solicitor is authorized to solicit on behalf of the permit holder. A copy of such credentials must be filed with the clerk-treasurer at the time the application for a permit is filed and must be approved by the clerk-treasurer as conforming to the requirements of this section before such permit is issued. No Person shall solicit under any permit granted under this chapter without the credentials required by this section and a facsimile copy of the permit in his possession. Said credentials and said facsimile copy of the permit must be shown, upon request, to all persons solicited and to any police officer of the city of Ephrata. No agent or solicitor shall solicit contributions for any charitable purpose for any person in the city of Ephrata unless such person has been granted a permit under the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 977 §9, 1978).
5.44.100 Written receipts required. Any person receiving money or anything having a value of one dollar or more from any contributor under a solicitation made pursuant to a permit granted under this chapter shall give to the contributor a written receipt signed by the solicitor showing plainly the name and permit number of the person under whose permit the solicitation is conducted, the date, and the amount received; provided however, that this section shall not apply to any contributions collected by means of a closed box or receptacle used in solicitation with the written approval of the clerk-treasurer where it is impractical to determine the amount of such contributions. (Ord. 977 §19, 1978).
5.44.110 Denial of application--Hearing. Within five days after receiving notification by registered mail that his application for a permit to solicit under this chapter has been denied, any applicant may file a written request for a public hearing on the application before the city council, together with written exceptions to the findings of face upon which the clerk-treasurer based his denial of the application. Upon the filing of such a request, the city council shall fix a time and place for the hearing and shall notify the applicant thereof. The hearing shall be held within five days after the request is filed. At the hearing the applicant may present evidence in support of his application and exceptions. Any interested person may, in the discretion of the city council, be allowed to participate in the past and present evidence in opposition to the application and exceptions. Within ten days after the conclusions of the hearing the city council shall render a written report either granting or denying the application for a permit. In this report the council shall state the facts upon which its decision is based, and its ruling upon any exceptions filed to the clerk-treasurer's
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 49
original findings of fact upon the application. This report shall be filed in the clerk-treasurer's office for public inspection and a copy shall be served by registered mail upon the applicant and all parties to the hearing. (Ord. 977 §11, 1978).
5.44.120 Revocation of permits--Hearing. Whenever it shall be shown, or whenever the clerk-treasurer has knowledge, that any person to whom a permit has been issued under this chapter has violated any of the provisions of this chapter, or that any promoter, agent or solicitor of a permit holder has misrepresented the purpose of the solicitation, the clerk-treasurer shall immediately suspend the permit and give the permit holder written notice by registered, special delivery mail of a hearing to be held within two days of such suspension to determine whether or not the permit should be revoked. This notice must contain a statement of the facts upon which the clerk-treasurer has acted in suspending the permit. At the hearing the permit holder, and any other interested person, shall have the right to present evidence as to the facts upon which the clerk-treasurer based the suspension of the permit, and any other facts which may aid the city council in determining whether this chapter has been violated and whether the purpose of the solicitation has been misrepresented. If, after such hearing, the council finds that this chapter has been violated, or the purpose of the solicitation has been misrepresented, it shall within two days after the hearing file in the clerk-treasurer's office for public inspection and serve upon the permit holders and all interested persons participating in the hearing, a written statement of the facts upon which the council bases such finding shall immediately revoke the permit. If, after such hearing the council finds that the ordinance has not been violated and the purpose of the solicitation has not been misrepresented, it shall within two days after the hearing give to the permit holder a written statement canceling the suspension of the permit and stating that no violation or misrepresentation was found to have been committed. (Ord. 977 §12, 1978).
5.44.130 Permit--Suspension or revocation--Notice to chief of police. The chief of police shall be notified forth-with by the clerk-treasurer of the suspension or revocation of any permit issued under this chapter.(Ord. 977 §13, 1978).
5.44.140 Record keeping. No person shall solicit any contributions for any charitable purpose without maintaining a system of accounting whereby all donations to it and all disbursements are entered upon the books or records of such person's treasurer or other financial officer. (Ord. 977 §14, 1978).
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 50
5.44.150 Permit holder's report. It shall be the duty of all persons issued permits under this chapter to furnish to the clerk-treasurer within thirty days after the solicitation has been completed, a detailed report and financial statement showing the amount raised by the solicitation, the amount expended in collecting such funds, including a detailed report of the wages, fees, commissions and expenses paid to any person in connection with such solicitation, and the disposition of the balance of the funds collected by the solicitation. This report shall be available for public inspection at the clerk-treasurer's office at any reasonable time; provided, however, that the clerk-treasurer may extend the time for the filing of the report required by this section for an additional period of thirty days upon proof that the filing of the report within the time specified will work unnecessary hardship on the permit holder. The permit holder shall make available to the clerk-treasurer, or to any person designated in writing by the clerk-treasurer, as the clerk-treasurer's representative for such purpose, all books, records, and papers whereby the accuracy of the report required by this section may be checked. (Ord. 977 §14, 1978).
5.44.160 Religious solicitations--Generally.
(a) No person shall solicit contributions for any religious purpose within the city of Ephrata without a certificate from the clerk-treasurer. Application for a certificate shall be made to the clerk-treasurer upon forms provided by the city of Ephrata. Such application shall be sworn to, or affirmed, and shall contain the following information, or in lieu thereof, a statement of the reason or reasons why such information cannot be furnished:
(1) The name and address or headquarters of the person applying for the permit;
(2) If the applicant is not an individual, the names and addresses of the applicant's principal officers and managers and a copy of the resolution, if any, authorizing such solicitation certified to as a true and correct copy of the original by the officer having charge of applicant's records;
(3) The purpose for which such solicitation is to be made, the total amount of funds proposed to be raised thereby, and the use or disposition to be made of any receipts therefrom;
(4) A specific statement, supported by reasons and, if available, figures, showing the need for the contributions to be solicited;
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 51
(5) The name and address of the person or persons by whom the receipts of such solicitations shall be disbursed;
(6) The name and address of the person or persons who will be in direct charge of conducting the solicitation and the names of all promoters connected or to be connected with the proposed solicitation;
(7) An outline of the method or methods to be used in conducting the solicitations;
(8) The time when such solicitations shall be made, giving the preferred dates for the beginning and ending of such solicitation;
(9) The estimated cost of the solicitation;
(10) The amount of any wages, fees, commissions, expenses or emoluments to be expended or paid to any person in connection with such solicitations and the names and addresses of all such persons;
(11) A financial statement for the last preceding fiscal year of any funds collected for religious purposes by the applicant, said statement giving the amount of money so raised, together with the cost of raising it and final distribution thereof;
(12) A full statement of the character and extent of the religious work being done by the applicant within the city of Ephrata;
(13) A statement to the effect that it a permit is granted, it will not be used or represented in any way as an endorsement by the city of Ephrata or by any department or officer thereof;
(14) Such other information as may be submitted to the clerk-treasurer in order for the clerk to determine the kind and character of the proposed solicitation.
(b) If, while any application is pending, or during the term of any certificate granted thereon, there is any change in fact, policy or method that would alter the information given in the application, the applicant shall notify the clerk-treasurer in writing thereof within twenty-four hours after such change.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 52
(c) Upon receipt of such application, the clerk-treasurer shall forthwith issue the applicant a certificate of registration. The certificate shall remain in force and effect for a period of six months after the issuance thereof, and shall be renewed upon the expiration of this period upon the filing of a new application as provided for in this section. Certificates of registration shall bear the name and address of the person by whom the solicitation is to be made, the number of the certificate, the date issued and a statement that the certificate does not constitute on endorsement by the city of Ephrata, or by any of its departments or officers, of the purpose or of the person conducting the solicitation. All persons to whom certificates of registration have been issued shall furnish credentials to conform to the requirements specified for credentials in Section 5.44.090 of this chapter, and a copy of such credentials shall be filed with the clerk-treasurer at the time of the filing of the application for a certificate.
No person shall solicit for any religious cause without having such credentials in his possession, together with a copy of the certificate of registration under which the solicitation is being conducted, and such person shall, upon demand, present these credentials and this copy of the certificate to any person solicited or to any police officer of the city of Ephrata; provided, however, that the provisions of this section shall not apply to any established person organized and operated exclusively for religious purposes and not operated for the pecuniary profit of any person, if the solicitations by such established person are conducted among the members thereof by other members or officers thereof, voluntarily and without re-enumeration for making such solicitations, or if the solicitations are in the form of collections or contributions at the regular assemblies or services of any such established person; nor shall the provisions of this chapter apply to any established person organized and operated exclusively for religious or charitable purposes, and holding a valid letter from the United States Internal Revenue Service certifying that such person is exempt from the payment of income taxes under Section 5038 of the Internal Revenue Code or any other applicable section; which organization has a slate of officers comprised of residents of the city of Ephrata and is regularly conducting its activities and meetings within the corporate limits of the city of Ephrata. (Ord. 977 §15, 1978).
5.44.170 Religious solicitations--Investigation. The clerk-treasurer is authorized to investigate the affairs of any person soliciting for religious purposes under a certificate issued under Section 5.44.160 and the affairs of any person
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 53
exempted from the requirement of a certificate under Section 5.44.020 or exempted under Section 5.44.160 and make public his written findings in order that the public may be fully informed as to the affairs of any of said persons. Said persons shall make available to the clerk-treasurer, or to any representative designated by the clerk-treasurer in writing for such specific purpose all books, records, or other information reasonably necessary to enable the clerk-treasurer to fully and fairly inform the public of all facts necessary to a full understanding by the public of the work and methods of operation or such persons; provided, that five days before the public release of any findings under this section, the clerk-treasurer must first serve a copy of said findings upon the person investigated and at the time of the release of his findings he must release a copy of any written statement said person may file with the clerk-treasurer in explanation, denial or confirmation of such findings. (Ord. 977 §17, 1978).
5.44.180 Misrepresentation prohibited. No person shall directly or indirectly solicit contributions for any purpose by misrepresentation of his name, occupation, financial condition, social condition or residence, and no person shall make or perpetrate any other misstatement, deception or fraud in connection with any solicitation of any contribution for any purpose in the city of Ephrata, or in any application or report filed under this chapter. (Ord. 977 §18, 1978).
5.44.190 Violation--Penalty. Any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter, or filing, or causing to be filed, an application for a permit or certificate under this chapter containing false or fraudulent misstatements, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined not less than one hundred dollars nor more than three hundred dollars, or shall be imprisoned for not more than thirty days, or may be punished by both fine and imprisonment. (Ord. 977 §19, 1978).
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 54
Chapter 5.48
PAWNBROKERS AND PAWNSHOPS
Sections:
5.48.010 License required--Fee.
5.48.020 Pawnbroker defined.
5.48.030 Application for license.
5.48.040 Records.
5.48.050 Transcript of record furnished to police.
5.48.060 Inspection of records.
5.48.070 When goods are not to be removed from pawnshop.
5.48.080 Closing hours.
5.48.090 Rates of interest and sale.
5.48.100 Violation declared misdemeanor.
5.48.010 License required--Fee. It is unlawful for any person to engage in the business of pawnbroker or conduct a pawnshop without a pawnbroker's license. The license shall be for a period of one year and the fee for such license shall be one hundred dollars. (Ord. 1025 §1, 1980).
5.48.020 Pawnbroker defined. Every person engaged, in whole or in part, in the business of loaning money on the security of pledges, deposits or conditional sales of personal property, shall be deemed to be a "pawnbroker." (Ord. 1025 §2, 1980).
5.48.030 Application for license. Application for a pawnbroker's license shall be in writing filed with the city council on forms furnished by the chief of police and shall be accompanied by the required fee. The application shall be referred to the police department for recommendation. If the city council approves the application it may by motion direct the issuance of the license by the city clerk. (Ord. 1025 §3, 1980).
5.48.040 Records.
(a) It shall be the duty of every pawnbroker to maintain at his place of business a book or other permanent record, in which shall be legibly written, in the English language at the time of such loan, purchase or sale, a record thereof containing the following:
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 55
(1) The date of the transaction;
(2) The name of the person or employee conducting the same;
(3) The name, age, street and house number, and the general description of the dress, complexion, color of hair and facial appearance of the person with whom the transaction is had;
(4) The name and street and house number of the owner of the property bought or received in pledge;
(5) The street and house number of the place from which the property bought or received in pledge was last removed;
(6) A description of the property bought or received in pledge, which, in the case of watches, shall contain the name of the maker and the number of both the works and the case, and in case of jewelry shall contain a description of all letters and marks inscribed thereon;
(7) The price paid or the amount loaned;
(8) The name and street and house numbers of all persons acting as a witness to the transaction;
(9) The number of any pawn tickets issued therefor.
(b) Anyone who pledges, sells or consigns any property to or with a pawnshop or pawnbroker shall sign the records required to be kept by such dealer with this true name and shall include his correct residence address. (Ord. 1025 §4, 1980).
5.48.050 Transcript of record furnished to police. It shall be the duty of every pawnbroker, before twelve noon of every business day, to report to the chief of police on blank form, to be furnished by the police department, a full, true and correct transcript of the record of all transactions had on the preceding day. It shall also be the duty of any pawnbroker having good cause to believe any property in his possession has been previously lost or stolen, to report such fact to the chief of police, together With the name of the owner, if known, and the date of and name of the person from whom the same was received by such pawnbroker. (Ord. 1025 §5, 1980).
5.48.060 Inspection of records. All books and other records of any pawnbroker relating to purchase, pledge, exchange, barter or receipt of any goods, wares, merchandise or other articles or things of value shall, during normal business hours, be open for inspection by the chief of police, or any police officer or city detective detailed for that purpose, and all articles
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 56
or things received, purchased or left in pledge with the pawnbroker shall at all like times be open to a like inspection. (Ord. 1025 §6, 1980).
5.48.070 When goods are not to be removed from pawnshop. It is unlawful for any pawnbroker to remove any goods, articles or thing purchased by him, in pledge, from his store or place of business until the expiration of four days after the receipt thereof shall have been reported to the chief of police as provided in this chapter, except when redeemed by the owner thereof. (Ord. 1025 §7, 1980).
5.48.080 Closing hours. It is unlawful for any pawnbroker to conduct or carry on the business of pawnbroker, in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, or to open, or keep open, his pawnshop for the transaction of any business whatsoever therein, during other than normal business hours. (Ord 1025 §8, 1980).
5.48.090 Rates of interest and sale. All pawnbrokers may charge and receive interest and fees in accordance with RCW 19.60.060. (Ord. 1025 §9, 1980).
5.48.100 Violation declared misdemeanor. Every pawnbroker and every clerk, agent, or employee of a pawnbroker is guilty of a misdemeanor, who does any of the following:
(a) Fails to make an entry of any material matter in his records; or
(b) Makes any false entry therein; or
(c) Falsifies, obliterates, destroys or removes from his place of business any book or record relating to his business; or
(d) Refuses to allow the city attorney or any peace officer to inspect his records, or any goods in his possession during the ordinary hours of business; or
(e) Knowingly reports any material matter falsely to the chief of police; or
(f) Having forms provided therefor, fails before noon of each day to furnish the chief of police with a full, true and correct transcript of the record of all transactions had on the previous day, it being the intent of this section that Saturday's business may be reported on Monday; or
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 57
(g) Fails to report forthwith to the chief of police the possession of any property which he may have good cause to believe has been lost or stolen, together with the name of the owner, if known, and the date when, and the name of the person from whom the same was received by him; or
(h) Removes or allows to be removed from his place of business, except upon redemption by the owner thereof, any property received, before four business days have elapsed since the receipt thereof was reported to the chief of police; or
(i) Receives any property from any person under the age of eighteen years, any common drunkard, any habitual user of narcotic drugs, any habitual criminal, any person in an intoxicated condition, any known thief or receiver of any stolen property, or any known associate of such thief or receiver of stolen property, whether such person is acting in his own behalf or as the agent of another; or
(j) Violates any other provision of this chapter; shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine of not more than three hundred dollars or by imprisonment in the county jail for not more than ninety days, or by both such fine and imprisonment. (Ord. 1025 '10, 1980).
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 58
Chapter 5.50
STREET DISPLAYS AND SALES
Sections:
5.50.010 Purpose
5.50.020 Definitions
5.50.030 License Required
5.50.040 Permit Application Procedure
5.50.050 License Regulations
5.50.060 Business Regulations
5.50.070 Permit Re-Registration
5.50.080 Permit Revocation
5.50.090 Exemptions
5.50.100 City Not Liable
5.50.110 Appeals
5.50.120 Decisions Final
5.50.130 Violations/Penalties
5.50.140 Severability
5.50.010 Purpose: Recently, the use of sidewalks and streets for business purposes, including but not limited to displays of merchandise, food and beverage sales, other retail activities, and other business uses, has increased. This has added interest and color to the downtown street scene, increased the general clutter on certain city streets and sidewalks; and created more crowded conditions for businesses, pedestrians, and vehicle travelers. It is anticipated that such use will likely increase as other vendors seek to sell to the large number of pedestrians on certain sidewalks, particularly during the summer months.
The primary purposes of streets and sidewalks are for use and efficient movement of pedestrians and vehicles. Use of streets and sidewalks for business activity is secondary, and should be restricted to areas regulated in such a way that safety and convenience of pedestrians and vehicles are maintained; and so that the aesthetic appeal of the city to its residents and visitors is preserved.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 59
It is also finding of the City Council that only a limited number and type of street merchants can be accommodated and still adequately provide for the primary purpose of use of the streets and sidewalks for circulation. to assure that undue congestion does not occur, street vending should be limited to simple goods such as appropriate merchandise of foods and beverages to be consumed immediately to reduce the time expected to be spent at the point of sale.
The City Council reserves to its own discretion adoption of regulations governing private use of the public right-of-way.
This ordinance seeks to accomplish these and other public purposes, and is in furtherance of the health, welfare and safety of the community.
5.50.020 Definitions: Throughout the Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires, the following definitions shall apply:
A. Abutting Property Owner means the owner of the building or lot immediately fronting the proposed location of a vending cart, sign or temporary stand.
B. Temporary Stand means any tables, chairs, or combination thereof, or any booth, tent, trailer, storeroom, street or sidewalk stand, temporary and/or open lunch counter, sandwich counter or soft drink and/or portable food containers, or other temporary place for the sale of goods, beverages, or consumption or the sale of any wares or merchandise of any kind and located upon or operated from alleyways, street, or sidewalk easements, public streets or sidewalks, or any other public space, or located directly adjacent to a public right-of-way or sidewalk could occur.
C. Vending Cart is a movable cart or vehicle that is operated from a fixed location from which food, flowers, merchandise and/or non-alcoholic beverages are offered or provided, or offered for sale or sold, to the public with or without charge.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 60
D. Street Vendor means any person, and their principals and agents, who engage or conduct in the City of Ephrata either in one locality or in traveling from place to place, a temporary or transient business for the purpose of selling, renting or soliciting offers for the sale of beverages, remedies, food, wares, merchandise or products of any kind whatsoever, and who, for the purposes of carrying on such business, use or occupy any temporary stand, vending cart or take-out window on any public street, alley or sidewalk, or any part thereof, or on private property adjacent to a public way or sidewalk where direct access to the business from a public right-of-way or sidewalk could occur, for the purpose of exhibition and sale or rental of such food, beverages, services, goods, wares, merchandise or products.
E. Person includes any person, partnership, corporation, association or other entity.
F. Merchandise Displayer means any person owning or operating a business of any kind which display goods, ware or merchandise on a public sidewalk, street or alley or on private property adjacent to a public way or sidewalk where direct access from a public right-of-way or sidewalk could
occur.
G. Display Vendor means any person owning or operating a business of any kind which display goods, ware or merchandise on private property adjacent to a public way or sidewalk where direct access from a public right-of-way or sidewalk could occur.
H. Street Vendor License means the license provided by this Ordinance.
I. Hawking is loud, repeated oral solicitation of business by the Vendor or Displayer or their agents, employees or contractors.
J. Director means the Community Development Director of the city, or his or her designee.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 61
K. Take-Out Window means any window or opening into a structure through which products of any kind are offered for sale directly to persons passing by on the sidewalk or public way.
L. Sidewalk Sign means any sandwich board, sign or device for the holding of advertising information which is placed upon a city sidewalk, street or alley for any purpose other than regulation of traffic or pedestrian by or with the permission of the city.
5.50.030 License Required:
(1) It shall be unlawful for any person to act as a street vendor or operate a temporary stand or take-out window adjacent to public right-of-way unless that person or his/her employees shall have first received a street vendor license. A street vendor license shall not be required in order to display merchandise on a public sidewalk if the display is by the abutting permanent business and conforms in all respect to the restrictions set forth in Section .060 of this Chapter. A street vendor license shall not be required for vending activities located on private property where the vending cart, temporary stand, take-out window or merchandise display is set back from the public way or sidewalk by six (6) feet or more.
(2) It shall be unlawful for any person to place or use sidewalk sign upon any public sidewalk or adjacent to public right-of-way unless that person or his/her employees shall have first received a street sign license. A street sign license shall be required in order to place a sidewalk sign on a public sidewalk if the sign is placed by the abutting permanent business and conforms in all respect to the restrictions set forth in Section .060 of this Chapter.
(3) It shall be unlawful for any person to operate a vending cart, temporary stand, take-out window or merchandise display set back from the public way or sidewalk six (6) feet or more unless that person or his/her employees shall have first received a display vendor license.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 62
(4) The operator of a business adjacent to any portion of sidewalk within the area covered by this Chapter shall have the first right to make application to place upon or adjacent to that portion of the sidewalk abutting the operator's business any of the devices provided for in this Chapter. If application is made to the city by other than the abutting business operator to locate a device allowed under this Chapter, the abutting operator shall have the opportunity to place a similar device upon the location prior to the city granting a license to any non-abutting business operator.
5.50.040 Permit Application Procedure: The following procedure shall be utilized in reviewing permit applications:
A. Application - Street Vendor. Any person desiring to obtain a street vendor license shall apply therefore to the city on forms provided by the city and such application shall set forth as to each principal street vendor applicant the following:
1. The name, address and telephone number of the principal applicant and principal operator, if different.
2. The nature or character of the food, merchandise, beverages, or flowers to offered or displayed by the applicant.
3. Name, address and both home and business telephone numbers of the individual acting as manager or operator for the principal applicant.
4. The address of the abutting building of the proposed street or sidewalks location of the business.
5. The name, address and telephone number of the abutting property owner of the proposed street or sidewalk location.
6. The length of time during which it is proposed that the business or display will be conducted.
7. The proposed hours of operation or display.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 63
8. The maximum number of persons proposed to work at the location at any given time.
9. Washington State Retail Sales Tax number of the street vendor.
10. City of Ephrata Business License number of the street vendor.
11. A drawing or set of specifications for any vending cart to be used which is of sufficient detail to allow the Director to determine that the cart will be structurally sound and safe.
12. Written response or comments on a form provided by the city to the proposed vending site from the abutting property owner.
13. The application shall be signed by the applicant and if the applicant is not the actual street vendor, the applicant shall verify his or her authority to act as agent from the street vendor.
B. Application - Street Sign. Any person desiring to obtain a street sign license shall apply therefor to the city on forms provided by the city and such application shall set forth the following:
1. The name, address and telephone number of the applicant.
2. The nature or character of the sign proposed to be displayed by the applicant including the size, type of construction, proposed permanent wording, colors and proposed days and hours of placement.
3. The address of the abutting building of the proposed street or sidewalk location of the business.
4. The name, address and telephone number of the abutting property owner of the proposed street or sidewalk location.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 64
5. Washington State Retail Sales Tax number of the applicant, if any.
6. City of Ephrata Business License number of the applicant.
7. A drawing or set of specifications for the street sign to be used which is of sufficient detail to allow the Director to determine that the sign will be structurally sound and safe and in conformity with the area proposed for the location of the street sign.
8. Written response or comments on a form provided by the city to the proposed street sign from the abutting property owner.
9. The application shall be signed by the applicant and if the applicant is not the actual street sign owner, the applicant shall verify his or her authority to act as agent from the street sign owner.
C. Application - Display Vendor. Any person desiring to obtain a display vendor license shall apply therefor to the city on forms provided by the city and such application shall set forth as to each principal applicant the following:
1. The name, address and telephone number of the principal applicant and principal operator, if different.
2. The nature or character of the food, merchandise, beverages, or flowers to be offered or displayed by the applicant.
3. Name, address and both home and business telephone numbers of the individual acting as manager or operator for the principal applicant.
4. The address of the adjacent building of the proposed display location of the business.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 65
5. The name, address and telephone number of the adjacent property owner of the proposed display location.
6. The length of time during which it is proposed that the business or display will be conducted.
7. The proposed hours of operation or display.
8. The maximum number of persons proposed to work at the location at any given time.
9. Washington State Retail Sales Tax number of the display vendor.
10. City of Ephrata Business License number of the display vendor.
11. A drawing or set of specifications for any display to be used which is of sufficient detail to allow the Director to determine that the display will be structurally sound and safe.
12. Written response or comments on a form provided by the city to the proposed vending site from the adjacent property owner.
13. The application shall be signed by the applicant and if the applicant is not the actual display vendor, the applicant shall verify his or her authority to act as agent from the display vendor.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 66
D. Application Fee.
(1) The completed application shall be filed with the Director with a non-refundable application fee of Fifty Dollars ($50.00), except that those applicants who are operators of a business located adjacent to the location where the street device is intended to be located and who have in place a valid business license shall not be required to pay such application fee. The Director shall not accept any application which appears incomplete or is not accompanied by the required fee. (Ord 93-27, 1993)
E. Application Review. The application, together with any additional information deemed relevant by the Director, shall be reviewed by the Director to determine whether the proposed business, sign or display shall be permitted at the proposed location. This determination shall be made within 14 days of the receipt of a complete application. In making his/her determination the director shall apply the following standards:
1. That the application and proposed sign, display or business are in conformity with this Chapter.
2. That the applicant and principals have conformed to this Chapter and other applicable regulations when previously operating vending carts, placing signs or operating displays.
3. When the abutting owner or tenant has submitted to the Director written objection to the retail stand site, the Director shall give due consideration to the impact that the sign, cart or display would have on the abutting property owner's business and duty to maintain the sidewalk area.
4. That any proposed vending cart, sign or display will structurally sound and safe for its proposed use.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 67
5. That the colors proposed for the vending facilities, sign or display are consistent with the color guidelines adopted by the Community Development Director unless the colors proposed have been separately approved by the Community Development Director.
6. That the proposed business or sign will be compatible with surrounding activities including nearby businesses.
7. That the proposed business or sign and its location will not intrude into the sidewalk pedestrian zone and will not unreasonably interfere with use of the street or sidewalk right-of-way by pedestrians or vehicles.
8. Each retail stand shall be limited to one assigned location. In the event that two or more applications for the same location are received, the general location standards of this Chapter shall be used to determine which application, if approved, shall be assigned the location.
9. No retail stand shall be placed within two hundred feet of any public or private school, park or playground, except when the entity having jurisdiction and control of such facility states in writing that it has no objection the placement of such retail stand within two hundred feet.
F. Application Approval:
1. The Director shall approve the application if the requirements of this Chapter have been met. However, the Director may specify reasonable conditions of approval to insure compatibility of the proposed business including hours of operation.
2. If the requirements of this Chapter have not been met, the application shall be denied in writing addressed to the applicant, setting forth the reason for denial.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 68
3. If an existing license is outstanding for the proposed location, a new application shall not be approved unless the previous licensee terminates his/her license.
G. License Issuance. Upon approval of the application a license will be issued to the applicant after the applicant has submitted to the Director the following:
1. A copy of an approved sign permit, if applicable.
2. A copy of any applicable Health District permit.
3. A copy of any applicable city business license or temporary business license.
4. Proof of liability insurance naming the City of Ephrata as additional insured in amount and policy provisions as approved by the City Clerk. Execution, in such form and substance as is acceptable to the city, of a hold harmless and indemnification agreement by which the licensee agrees to hold harmless and indemnify the city, its officers, agents, employees, and contractors from and against any and all liability arising out of the conduct and operation of the licensee's business or placement of the licensee's sign.
5. Payment of a non-refundable license fee in the amount specified in subsection D.
Upon receipt of the above, the license shall be issued, which shall contain such restrictions and conditions as contained in, and necessary to, properly administer the terms of this Chapter.
H. License Term. Each license shall be for a term not to exceed one (1) year, commencing on January 1 of the calendar year in which the license is issued, and terminating on December 31st of that year, unless otherwise revoked pursuant to this Chapter.
5.50.050 License Regulations: the following regulations shall apply for all licenses issued pursuant to this Chapter:
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 69
A. Nontransferability. No license hereunder may be transferred or assigned to any other person.
B. Display of License Required. The license shall be prominently displayed at all times on the vending cart. The license shall be exhibited to any police officer of to the Director or his/her designee upon his/her request.
C. Compliance With Other Laws and Permits. The license shall at all times comply with all laws, regulations and permits applicable to the licensee's business, provided, however, that no off-street parking requirements shall exist or be imposed for any operation or that part thereof being conducted solely under a license issued under this Chapter.
5.50.060 License Regulations: The following regulations shall apply to all street vendor license holders and merchandise displayers and their agents, employees and contractors, and to the conduct, operation and location of the business:
A. Maintenance of Required Permits. All required licenses and permits issued by the City of Ephrata must be displayed in a prominent, visible manner. Street vendor operations must have a permit from the Grant County Health Department, when required, and must comply with all applicable Health Department Requirements.
B. Area Restrictions.
(1) If the location is a public sidewalk, a minimum sidewalk clearance of (5) feet shall be maintained. Such clear area shall be continuous and shall maintain a five foot open space for pedestrian travel. The Director shall attach sufficient conditions to any license issued pursuant to this Chapter to insure safe pedestrian travel through and by any device allowed under this Chapter. Failure to maintain such clear corridor of travel shall subject the license holder to a civil penalty of up to $1000.00 for each violation of this provision.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 70
(2) Vending carts, street signs and merchandise displays on public sidewalks shall be placed more than five (5) feet from the adjacent building face or right-of-way limit. If located on a street, the business shall be oriented and operated to sidewalk traffic and not to vehicle traffic.
(3) No street vending cart, street sign or merchandise display upon a public sidewalk shall be permitted nor shall any permit be issued for any area within the city other than the area defined as the entirety of Basin Street beginning at the intersection of Second Avenue SW and Basin Street and extending through the intersection of Second Avenue NW and Basin Street including all four corners of all intersecting streets for a distance of approximately 20 feet from the point of intersection with Basin Street on Second Avenue NW, First Avenue NW, Division Street, First Avenue SW and Second Avenue SW and C Street beginning at the intersection of Division Avenue W and C Street and extending through the intersection of First Avenue NW and C Street and extending through the intersection of First Avenue NW and Alder Street NW and extending through the intersection of Alder Street NW and Division Avenue W and extending through the intersection of Division Avenue W and C Street NW including all four corners of all intersecting streets for a distance of approximately 20 feet from the point of intersection with Division Avenue or First Avenue NW except by resolution of the City Council.
(4) Merchandise displays located off public sidewalks and upon private property adjoining public right-of-way shall not be permitted nor shall any permit be issued for any area within the city other than Basin Street Southwest, both sides, except by resolution of the City Council.
C. Assigned Location. The street vendor shall at all times locate and operate the business together with the vending cart in the assigned location. Mobile vending is not permitted except by special resolution of the city council defining when and where such mobile vending may occur.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 71
D. Size. The maximum permissible size for any vending cart shall be three (3) feet wide by five (5) feet long by five (5) feet high, except that incidental accessories may be attached or placed within eighteen (18) inches of the ends of the cart where approved by the Director. A canopy or umbrella may be included with the stand which may not exceed a diameter of seven feet six inches. The canopy or umbrella shall be of vinyl, canvas or similar durable material. Any part of such umbrella or canopy must have a minimum of seven feet of vertical clearance to the sidewalk and must not extend more that two feet from the edge of the cart in any direction. Take-out windows shall not exceed the maximum length for vending carts allowed under these regulations.
Street signs shall be of a maximum width not to exceed thirty-two inches, a maximum height not to exceed forty-eight inches, and a maximum length not to exceed thirty-six inches.
E. Goods. Food, non-alcoholic beverages, and flowers are the only goods permitted to be offered, displayed or sold from vending carts except by special resolution of the city council. Merchandise displayers who are operating without use of a vending cart or temporary stand may display merchandise which is also on display within the permanent, abutting building. No other goods, merchandise or services of any kind are permitted.
F. Self-Contained. Each street vendor's stand shall be a self-contained unit; PROVIDED, however, that self-contained electrical power generators are not permitted. Street signs are not allowed to be lighted or energized with electricity in any way. utility service connections are not permitted, except that electrical service connections may be permitted when provided by the adjacent property owner and when the following requirements are met for carts, stands and displays located off the public sidewalk and upon parking lots or other places:
1. Electrical lines are not allowed overhead or lying on the sidewalk.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 72
2. The outlet location must be placed outside the walkways which are accessible to public and private use.
3. Length of electrical hook-up must be within 15 feet of the stand.
4. No extension cords will be allowed.
5. The hook-up must be permanently wired to the cart, stand or display and meet National electrical Code requirements as to type, size, and grounding, terminating in an approved outside weatherproof GFCI (ground fault circuit interrupting) type receptacle.
6. Each cart, stand or display shall require an electrical permit unless previously UL approved, and require inspection prior to operation of the stand.
G. Removal of Carts, signs and Merchandise Each vending cart, each street sign and all displayed merchandise must be removed from the public right-of-way upon close of business each day. No retail stand shall be left unattended at any time.
H. Loud Noises/Sound Devices. Mechanical audio or noise-making devices, sound amplification or reproduction devices or hawking are not permitted.
I. False Statements If at any time it is found that any false statements were made in the application, any license hereunder may be revoked.
J. Obstruction of Right-of-Way no vending cart, temporary stand, take-out window or merchandise display shall be located or operated in a way which unreasonably obstructs pedestrian or vehicle traffic. No lines of persons or customers shall be permitted which reduce the required sidewalk clearance.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 73
K. Obedience to Police Orders. All persons conducting a retail stand business shall obey any order of a police officer to temporarily move such retail stand to avoid congestion or obstruction of the surrounding area for pedestrian and/or vehicular traffic.
L. No Chaining. Retail stands shall not be located immediately next to or chained to street furniture or trees.
M. Fire Extinguisher Required. All street vendor's retail stands have one 2A10BC fire extinguisher mounted on the cart or in the display.
N. Intersection Restriction No retail stand shall be located within ten (10) feet of the intersection of the adjacent sidewalk with any other sidewalk.
O. Clean Up/Maintenance Each operator of a vending cart or merchandise display site must be kept clean and orderly at all times and pick up any refuse or debris and clean up liquid spillage deposited by any person within 25 feet of the vendor's business location. Additionally, all such persons shall provide a refuse container for litter disposal by customers or other persons, which container shall be of a design approved by the city and which must be removed each day, along with the stand. City litter receptacles may not be substituted for this purpose. Food product vendors shall also provide recycling facilities if recycling facilities if recyclable materials are sold from the vending cart or merchandise display.
P. Signs. All signs shall conform to provisions of the Ephrata Municipal Code and any license issued hereunder. The total sign area displayed on a vending cart shall not exceed six (6) square feet. No advertising shall be permitted of any business or establishment other than the business licensed to operate the vending cart. Signage for any street vendor licensed hereunder shall not be included in the allowable sign area of the abutting building.
Q. Parking Lot Locations. Any cart, merchandise display or take-out window located in a parking lot shall comply with the following minimum standards:
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 74
1. The cart, display or window shall not block entrances and exists to the parking lot or fire exit doors of any buildings.
2. The cart, display or window shall only occur in parking lots containing more than 10 spaces.
3. No cart or display shall occur in parking spaces directly in front of entrances or windows of a building.
R. Annual Fee An annual fee in the amount of $100.00 shall be paid at the time of issuance of any license required by this Chapter, except as provided herein. If an application is approved or approved with conditions, the applicant shall pay an additional Fifty Dollars ($50.00) to complete the initial annual license fee of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) required of those wishing to act as a street vendor, operate a temporary stand, operate a take-out window, place a street sign or operate a display sales operation. If a take-out window or a street sign, temporary stand or street display is licensed to an existing permanent business for placement on the sidewalk abutting that business, no fee shall be required so long as a business license is maintained by the business. If a temporary stand, street sign or street display is licensed to an existing permanent business for placement on or off a public sidewalk not abutting or adjacent to that business, no annual fee of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) shall be charged for each year following the first year of operation so long as a business license is maintained. (Ord 93-27, 1993).
5.50.070 Permit Re-Registration: Whenever a licensed vendor ceases doing business in the City for a period of thirty (30) days or more, prior to resumption of business, the vendor shall register by notifying the Director in writing. Any such re-registration shall not be valid beyond the term of the original license.
5.50.080 Permit Revocation: A license may be summarily revoked
under the following conditions:
A. Failure to comply with any of the terms of this Chapter.
B. Failure to comply with the terms of the license.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 75
C. Misrepresentation of facts in the licensee's application for the license or any other necessary permit.
D. Creation of any unreasonable hazard to the public health or unreasonably interfering with park availability, vehicle or pedestrian access or travel.
E. Wherever a licensed vendor ceases doing business within the City for a period of one hundred eighty (180) days, or for any consecutive fourteen (14) day period between April 15 and October 15 of any calendar year.
F. As otherwise provided herein.
5.50.090 Exemptions: The following persons and activities shall be exempt from the licensing requirements under this Chapter:
A. Newspaper carriers and newspaper dispensing machines.
B. Non-profit civic, charitable, fraternal, religious and youth organizations, such as Little League, Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts and similarly situated non-profit organizations operating for short term special events or activities after notification of the Director.
C. Those community activities authorized and permitted by City Council resolution.
5.50.100 City Not Liable: Neither the City of Ephrata, nor its officers, agents, employees or contractors, shall be liable for any claim, loss, injury or damage to persons or property of whatsoever kind or nature, caused in whole or in part by or arising directly or indirectly out of the issuance of any license hereunder, or the placement of any street sign, or the conduct or operation of any such street vending business or merchandise display by any person.
5.50.110 Appeals: Any decision made by the Director hereunder may be appealed in writing by the aggrieved party to the City Council within fourteen (14) days following the date of the decision. Any and all such appeals shall be subject to the payment of a Fifty Dollar ($50.00) fee.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 76
5.50.120 Decisions Final: Any decision, finding, ruling, or order or determination of the Director or the City Council made pursuant to this title shall be final at the time a final order or decision is issued in written form, and no action to set aside or modify the same shall be brought in the Superior Court or other tribunal unless the action shall be filed within ten (10) days from the effective date of such decision, finding, or ruling, order or determination.
5.50.130 Violations/Penalties: Any person who is found to have violated any term or provision of this Chapter or of any permit hereunder shall be deemed to have committed a civil infraction and shall be liable for the payment of a civil penalty.
For the first such violation the civil penalty shall be in the amount of $200.00. For the second infraction by the same person within a period of two (2) years, the penalty shall be $400.00. Upon the third violation within a period of two (2) years, such violation shall constitute a C-1 penalty.
The city may seek injunctive relief to restrain any violations of the provisions of this Chapter. Violations of this Chapter, as determined by the Director shall constitute grounds for revocation of any license issued pursuant to this Chapter as well as revocation of all business licenses issued to the violator by the city.
5.50.140 Severability: In the event any one or more of the provisions of this Chapter shall for any reason be held to be invalid, such invalidity shall not affect or invalidate any other provision of this Chapter, but this Chapter shall be construed and enforced as if such invalid provision had not been contained therein; provided, that any provision which shall for any reason be held by reason of its extent to be invalid shall be deemed to be in effect to the extent permitted by law.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 77
Chapter 5.60
TELECOMMUNICATION USE FEES
Sections:
5.60.010 Findings
5.60.020 Chapter Supplemental
5.60.030 Application Fees
5.60.010 Findings. In furtherance of the provisions of the RCW Chapter 35.99 and Section 35A.21.245, Chapter 12.20 of this Code was adopted. This chapter provides for fees to be imposed and collected in connection with the operation of telecommunication systems, services and facilities within the city.
5.60.020 Chapter Supplemental.
A. The provisions of this chapter are supplemental to and not a replacement of other provisions of this Code. When required by this Code or any other applicable law or regulation, entities subject to the provisions of this chapter shall obtain all licenses and permits required by such other laws or regulations, including a city business license, and maintain those in a current status as a condition of being in compliance with this chapter and chapter 12.20.
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE 5 - 78
B. Every cable television service provider, whether they are required to obtain a franchise for the use of city rights-of-way or not, shall be required to remit the appropriate utility tax on all gross revenues. “Gross Revenues” means all amounts accrued by Grantee in whatever form and from all sources, from the operation of Grantee’s Cable System to provide Cable Service within the Franchise Area. “Gross Revenues” shall include, without limitation, all amounts for all Cable Services, including, but not limited to, basic, expanded basic, premium, and pay-per-view services, advertising sales and installation fees and charges. “Gross Revenues” shall also include any revenue received by any Affiliate of Grantee where such revenue in the ordinary course of business has been paid or should have been paid to Grantee from the operation of its Cable system to provide Cable Service within the Franchise Area. By way of illustration and not limitation, this definition would include revenue derived from the sale of Cable System advertising time by an Affiliate of Grantee. “Gross Revenues” shall not include bad debt, sales taxes, or other taxes which are collected by Grantee on behalf of, and for payment to, the local, state or federal government.
5.60.030 Application Fees. That the following fees for processing telecommunication right-of-way use authorization applications and renewals and facilities leases and renewals shall be deposited with the described application, lease or renewal. Such fees shall be used to cover the City’s costs related to staff, consultants or experts in the processing of the application, lease or renewal. Any unused portion of the fee shall be refunded to the applicant at the conclusion of the application, lease or renewal process. The following fees for processing telecommunication right-of-way use authorization applications and renewals and facilities leases and renewals are created:
Telecommunications license $1,000
Renewal of telecommunications license $ 500
Telecommunications franchise $3,000
Telecommunications franchise renewal $1,500
Cable franchise $4,000
Cable franchise renewal $2,000
(Ord. 01-08, 2001)(Ord. 06-29, 2006)

Chapter 6.04
WASTE DISPOSAL REGULATIONS
Sections:
6.04.010 Garbage storage prohibited where.
6.04.020 Offensive sewer, privy, cesspool prohibited.
6.04.030 Privy, cesspool location restrictions.
6.04.040 Privy, cesspool construction requirements.

6.04.060 Manure disposal requirements.

6.04.090 Violation--Penalty.
6.04.010 Garbage storage prohibited where. It is unlawful for the owner, lessee, occupant or agent of any building or premises, within the incorporated limits of the city, to keep or permit to be kept in any building or upon any premises, or in or upon any areaway, alley, street or public place adjacent to any building or premises, any waste, animal or vegetable matter of any nature whatsoever; or to keep or permit to be kept in or upon any of the aforesaid places any dead animals, butcher's offal, fish or part of fish, ashes, swill, or any refuse matter from any restaurant, eating place, residence or place of business; or to keep or permit to be kept in or upon any of the aforesaid places any tin can or cans which have formerly contained any fruit, animal or vegetable matter of any nature whatsoever. (Ord. 17 §1, 1909).
6.04.020 Offensive sewer, privy, cesspool prohibited. It is unlawful for any owner, lessee, occupant or agent of any building or premises within the incorporated limits of the city, to suffer, permit or allow any cellar vault, private drain, cesspool, privy or sewer, upon the premises to become nauseous, offensive or injurious to public health. (Ord. 17 §2, 1909).
6.04.030 Privy, cesspool location restrictions. It is unlawful for any person, persons, firm, association or corporation hereafter to construct within the city limits, any privy, vault or cesspool within twenty-five feet of any residence or any house or building used as such or within two feet of the line of any lot. (Ord. 42 (part), 1913: Ord. 17 §3, 1909).
6.04.040 Privy, cesspool construction requirements. All vaults, privies or cesspools hereafter constructed within the incorporated limits of the city shall be not less than six feet deep or less than four feet in diameter, if circular; or not less than twelve square feet in area if in any other form. All vaults, privies or cesspools which now exist or which shall hereafter be constructed in the city shall be closely boxed or walled at the top with the privy, vault or cesspool building. A ventilating pipe of wood or other material of not less than four inches in diameter shall extend from the top of the vault, privy or cesspool to two feet above the building, or case of a cesspool which is not covered by a building. The vent pipe shall extend at least twelve feet above the top of the cesspool. (Ord. 17 §4, 1909).
Page 3 of 45
EPHRATA MUNICIPAL CODE
6.04.050 Garbage deposit in privy, cesspool prohibited. It is unlawful for any person or persons to throw or deposit in any privy, vault or cesspool, any garbage, cans, crockery, glassware, or any other rubbish of any nature whatsoever; and the owner, agent or occupant of the premises shall be responsible for its condition. No building shall be used as a dwelling unless the same is provided with a privy vault or is properly connected with a cesspool or sewer. (Ord. 17 §5, 1909).
6.04.060 Manure disposal requirements. No pile or deposit of manure or excrement shall be allowed to accumulate on any place within the incorporated limits of the city, unless it be protected in such a manner, as not to become a nuisance or deleterious to the public health and must be removed within twenty-four hours after the parties allowing the same to accumulate shall have received from the police chief notice to remove it. (Ord. 17 §6, 1909).
6.04.070 Deposit site designation. It shall be the duty of the city council to designate some suitable place in which any and all of the matter described in this chapter may be deposited and to have the matter destroyed by fire. (Ord. 17 §7, 1909).
6.04.080 Premises inspection. It shall be the duty of the police chief to, from time to time, inspect any and all of the places described in this chapter; and for this purpose he shall have the right to enter any and all places or premises within the incorporated limits of the city at any reasonable time. (Ord. 17 §8, 1909).
6.04.090 Violation--Penalty.
(a) Violations of Sections 6.04.010, 6.04.020, 6.04.030, 6.04.040, 6.04.050 and 6.04.060 of the Ephrata Municipal Code constitute a nuisance and constitute civil infractions.
(b) Each day the infraction continues to exist shall be an additional infraction.
(c)A C-20 penalty shall be levied against the owner, lessee, occupant or agent of any building or premises maintained in violation of the code sections mentioned in subsection (a) for each civil infraction. (Ord. 12-11, 2012)
(d) Additionally, the court may require the owner, lessee, occupant or agent of any building or premises maintained in violation of the code sections mentioned in subsection (a) reimburse the city for costs incurred by the city for abatement and removal of the nuisance. (Ord. 1163 §1, 1986).

Chapter 6.08
GARBAGE REFUSE
Sections:
6.08.005 Garbage Service
